title: The complete works of Robert Burns :
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Turnip and sheep husbandry, their great improvements — Mr. M'Dowal, at Caverton Mill, a friend of Mr. Ainslie's, with whom I dined to-day, sold his sheep, ewe and lamb together, at two guineas a piece.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Turnip and sheep husbandry,  their great improvements — Mr. M'- Dowal, at Caverton Mill, a friend of Mr. Ainslie" s, with whom I dined to-day, sold his sheep, ewe and lamb together, at two guineas a piece — wash their sheep before shearing — seven or eight pounds of washen wool in a fleece — low markets, consequently low rents — fine lands not above sixteen shillings a Scotch acre — magnificence  of farmers and farm-houses — come up Teviot and up Jed to Jedburgh to lie, and so wish myself a good night.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Turnip and sheep husbandry,  their great improvements — Mr. M'- Dowal, at Caverton Mill, a friend of Mr. Ainslie' s, with whom I dined to-day, sold his sheep, ewe and lamb together, at two guineas a piece — wash their sheep before shearing — seven or eight pounds of washen wool in a fleece — low markets, consequently low rents — fine lands not above sixteen shillings a Scotch acre — magnificence  of farmers and farm-houses — come up Teviot and up Jed to Jedburgh to lie, and so wish myself a good night.
